name: abort
description: Is used to conditionally abort the execution of a macro.

abrt.description: `0` if the abort function should abort the macro, nonzero if it should not.

notes: Note that only the output of the macro is discarded when the macro is aborted any changes made to macros will not be undone.

name: absolutevalue
description: Returns the absolute value of a number.

num.description: The number to take the absolute value of.

notes: The absolute value of a number is the number without the sign.

name: add
description: Retruns the sum of two or more numbers, or concatenates multiple strings together.
notes: If at least one argument is a string, then all non-string arguments will also be treated as strings. That is, they will be passed to the `string()` function first, then concatenated normally.

name: addAllNPCsToInitiative
description: Adds all **NPC** tokens on the Token layer of the current map to the initiative panel.
returns: the number of tokens that were *added* to the initiative panel. Tokens already on the initiative panel are not counted.
notes: This function will not assign any initiative value to the tokens. You can use `setInitiative()` to set the initiative value of a token.

name: addAllPCsToInitiative
description: Adds all **PC** tokens on the Token layer of the current map to the initiative panel.
returns: the number of tokens that were *added* to the initiative panel. Tokens already on the initiative panel are not counted.
notes: This function will not assign any initiative value to the tokens. You can use `setInitiative()` to set the initiative value of a token.

name: addAllToInitiative
description: Adds *all* tokens on the Token layer of the current map to the initiative panel.
returns: the number of tokens that were *added* to the initiative panel. Tokens already on the initiative panel are not counted.
notes: This function will not assign any initiative value to the tokens. You can use `setInitiative()` to set the initiative value of a token.

name: addTableEntry
description: Adds a new row to the specified table.

tableName.description: A string containing the name of the Table.

rangeStart.description: An integer indicating the lowest value that will return this row.

rangeEnd.description: An integer indicating the highest value that will return this row.

result.description: A string containing the result returned by the table() function.

tableName.description: A string containing the name of the Table.

rangeStart.description: An integer indicating the lowest value that will return this row.

rangeEnd.description: An integer indicating the highest value that will return this row.

result.description: A string containing the result returned by the table() function.

imageId.description: Optional and is the asset id of an image that will be returned by the `tableImage()` function.

notes: Adding a row to a table will not automatically change the table row value, so this should be updated to avoid possible errors (See setTableRoll() function).

name: addToInitiative
description: Adds the Current Token to the initiative panel. Additional parameters allow you to specify the token and an initiative value.

AllowDuplicates.description: If false (default) then will not add the token if it is already in the initiative list. If true (1) an additional entry will be added to the initiative list (so there could be multiple initiative entries for the same token).

If false (default) then will not add the token if it is already in the initiative list. If true (1) an additional entry will be added to the initiative list (so there could be multiple initiative entries for the same token).

value.description: The initiative value to set. If included, the initiative will be set even if the token is already on the initiative list and duplicates are not allowed.

AllowDuplicates.description: If false (default) then will not add the token if it is already in the initiative list. If true (1) an additional entry will be added to the initiative list (so there could be multiple initiative entries for the same token).

value.description: The initiative value to set. If included, the initiative will be set even if the token is already on the initiative list and duplicates are not allowed.

tokenRef.description: Either the token id or Token Name of the token to add to the initiative. Defaults to the Current Token.

AllowDuplicates.description: If false (default) then will not add the token if it is already in the initiative list. If true (1) an additional entry will be added to the initiative list (so there could be multiple initiative entries for the same token).

value.description: The initiative value to set. If included, the initiative will be set even if the token is already on the initiative list and duplicates are not allowed.

tokenRef.description: Either the token id or Token Name of the token to add to the initiative. Defaults to the Current Token.

mapname.description: If false (default) then will not add the token if it is already in the initiative list. If true (1) an additional entry will be added to the initiative list (so there could be multiple initiative entries for the same token).

returns: Returns 1 if added to the initiative, 0 if did not.
notes: Token IDs are unique, but Token Names can be duplicated. Using Token Name when more than one token has the same name can produce unexpected results.

name: and
description: Performs a logical AND comparison between all of the passed numeric values.

numbers.description: The values to apply logical and to.

returns: `1` (true) If *all* input values are truthy (non-zero), otherwise returns `0` (false).
notes: A value of `0` is `false` and all non-zero values are treated as `true`

name: arg
description: Is used to extract arguments that are passed to a macro when called as a user defined function.

index.description: The index of the argument to return. Indexes begin at 0.

returns: The value of the specified argument passed into the user-defined function.
notes: The `argCount()` function is often used in conjunction with arg() to determine the number of arguments that have been passed to the user defined function.

name: argCount
description: Is used to determine the number of arguments that have been passed to a user defined function.
returns: The number of arguments passed to the user-defined function this (`argCount`) is called from.
notes: Once the number of arguments have been determined you can use `arg()` to retrieve them.

name: arsMagicaStress
description: For Ars Magica.

name: arsMagicaStressNum
description: For Ars Magica.

name: assert
description: Halts execution and prints a custom error message if a condition is `false` (`0`)

condition.description: The test condition that must evaluate to `true` (`1`) for the macro to continue.

message.description: The custom error message that is presented if the macro is halted due to the `false` (`0`) condition.

condition.description: The test condition that must evaluate to `true` (`1`) for the macro to continue.

message.description: The custom error message that is presented if the macro is halted due to the `false` (`0`) condition.

prefix.description: Determines if the error message should have the message prefix 'Macro defined error: '. Defaults to true(1), set to false(0) if you do not wish your custom error message to have the message prefix.

notes:
When aborting a macro called from another macro (for example, a library token), all macros are aborted, not just the one executing.
Since 1.5.0 you can change that behaviour by using macro.catchAssert.

name: average
description: Calculates the average (arithmetic mean) of all of the numbers that are passed in.
returns: The arithmetic mean of the arguments.
notes: The arithmetic mean is equal to the sum of all the arguments divided by the number of arguments.

name: base64.decode
description: Accepts a Base64 encoded string and decodes it to plain text.

string.description: The base64 encoded string to be decoded.

returns: The decoded string.

name: base64.encode
description: Takes the supplied text string and encodes it to Base64.

string.description: The text string to be encoded.

returns: The encoded string.

name: bitwiseand
description: Performs the bitwise 'and' operation of the arguments.

num.description: The numbers to perform the operation with.

returns: number

name: bitwisenot
description: Performs the bitwise 'not' operation of the arguments.

num.description: The numbers to perform the operation with.

returns: number

name: bitwiseor
description: Performs the bitwise 'or' operation of the arguments.

num.description: The numbers to perform the operation with.

returns: number

name: bitwisexor
description: Performs the bitwise 'xor' operation of the arguments.

num.description: The numbers to perform the operation with.

returns: number

name: bringDrawingToFront
description: For a specified drawing, moves the drawing to in front of all other drawings on the same layer.
notes: he easiest way to discover a drawing's Id is via the Draw Explorer interface.

name: bringToFront
description: Adjust the z order (or draw order) of the Token so that is is drawn after all other Tokens on the same Map Layer.

tokenRef.description: Either the token `id` or Token Name of the token to effect, defaults to the `Current Token`.
Either the token `id` or Token Name of the token to effect, defaults to the `Current Token`.

mapname.description: The name of the map to find the token. Defaults to the current map.

notes: Token IDs are unique, but Token Names can be duplicated. Using Token Name when more than one token has the same name can produce unexpected results.

name: broadcast

message.description: a message that is broadcasted to the users that are listed as parameters.
a message that is broadcasted to the users that are listed as parameters.

targets.description: a String list or JSON array of Player names, not Token names. Also recognizes: 'gm', 'gm-self', 'self', 'none', 'all', 'not-gm', 'not-self', and 'not-gm-self' as valid parameters. Defaults to 'all'.

message.description: a message that is broadcasted to the users that are listed as parameters.

targets.description: a String list or JSON array of Player names, not Token names. Also recognizes: 'gm', 'gm-self', 'self', 'none', 'all', 'not-gm', 'not-self', and 'not-gm-self' as valid parameters. Defaults to 'all'.

delimiter.description: The delimiter used to separate the values in the String List that is given, defaults to ','. If 'json' is specified, a JSON array is expected instead of a String List.

notes: `targets` is inclusive, so setting it to 'not-gm, gm' will send the message to all connected players - all non-GMs and all GMs.

description: Returns a json array of the points visible on the target token from the source token as an enumerated list. Default source is Current Token.

target.description: Either the token `id` or Token Name of target token.
Either the token `id` or Token Name of target token.

source.description: Either the token `id` or Token Name of the source, i.e. viewing token

target.description: Either the token `id` or Token Name of target token.

source.description: Either the token `id` or Token Name of the source, i.e. viewing token

mapname.description: The name of the map to find the two tokens. Defaults to the current map.

returns: JSON Array. The enumerated list will contain zero to five of the following values: `TOP_RIGHT`, `BOTTOM_RIGHT`, `TOP_LEFT`, `BOTTOM_LEFT`, `CENTER`.
notes: When a token is not visible, an empty json array is returned: '[]'

name: capitalize
description: Capitalizes the first letter of each word in a string.

treatNumbersSymbolsAsBoundaries.description: Whether numbers and symbols should be treated as word boundaries - defaults to true(1).

returns: The capitalized string.
notes: By default, numbers and symbols in the strings are treated as word boundaries.

name: ceiling
description: Returns the number passed in if it is an integer, otherwise it returns the number rounded up to the next integer.
returns: The number passed in if it is an integer, otherwise it returns the number rounded up to the next integer.

name: clearLights
description: Turns off all of the light sources for a Token.

tokenRef.description: Either the token id or Token Name of the token for which to turn off all light sources, defaults to the Current Token.
Either the token id or Token Name of the token for which to turn off all light sources, defaults to the Current Token.

mapname.description: The name of the map to find the token. Defaults to the current map.

notes: Token IDs are unique, but Token Names can be duplicated. Using Token Name when more than one token has the same name can produce unexpected results.

name: clearRolls
description: Clears the internal array that keeps track of the individual dice rolls for the current macro.

name: clearTable
description: Removes all rows from the specified table.

name: closeDialog
description: Closes the specified macro dialog that was previously created using [ dialog():].

name.description: The name of the dialog to close.

notes: If the dialog is not open then the function has no effect.

name: closeFrame
description: Closes the specified macro frame that was previously created using [frame():].

name.description: The name of the frame to close.

notes: If the frame is not open then the function has no effect.

name: closeOverlay
description: Closes/deregisters the specified overlay that was previously created using [overlay():].

name.description: The name of the overlay to close.

notes: If the overlay is not registered then the function has no effect. Note that while each connected client can hide any overlay from the `Window > Overlays` menu, they still run in the background unless you use this function to close them.

name: copyMap
description: Creates a copy of an specified map, with the new map name. Returns the name of the new map.

existingMapName.description: The name of the existing map you wish to copy.

newMapName.description: The name of the new copy.

returns: The name of the new map.

name: copyTable
description: Creates a copy (with a new name) of an existing MapTool table.

oldname.description: The name of the existing table. It's an error if the table doesn't exist.

newname.description: The name of the new table to be created. It's an error if the table already exists.

name: copyToken
description: Creates one or more copies of a Token and returns the id of the created copy. This function is used to copy Tokens into the current map,

tokenRef.description: Either the token id or Token Name of the token to copy.
Either the token id or Token Name of the token to copy.

numCopies.description: The number of copies to create, defaults to `1`.

tokenRef.description: Either the token id or Token Name of the token to copy.

numCopies.description: The number of copies to create, defaults to `1`.

fromMap.description: The name of the map to copy from, defaults to the current map.

tokenRef.description: Either the token id or Token Name of the token to copy.

numCopies.description: The number of copies to create, defaults to `1`.

fromMap.description: The name of the map to copy from, defaults to the current map.

updates.description: A JSON Object that contains updates to be made to the copied Tokens.

returns: If `numCopies` is 1, returns the `id` of the new token. If `numCopies` > 1, returns a JSON Array containing the Token ids of all the newly created Tokens.
notes: See the wiki for details about the `updates` parameter.

name: countStrProp
description: Returns the number of keys in a string property list.
returns: The number of keys in a string property list.

name: countsuccess
description: Generates random numbers to emulate dice rolls; returns the count of dice rolls that are above a certain target number.

times.description: The number of times to roll the die.

sides.description: The number of sides the die possesses.

target.description: The number that a die needs to be equal to or higher to be considered a success.

returns: The number of die rolls that are successes, i.e. the number of rolls with a result greater than or equal to `target`.

name: createMacro
description: Creates a macro button for the Current Token and returns the index of the newly created button.

label.description: The label for the macro button.

command.description: The command to run when the macro button is clicked, or the macro is called.

label.description: The label for the macro button.

command.description: The command to run when the macro button is clicked, or the macro is called.

props.description: A String Property List or JSON Object containing the properties for the button.

label.description: The label for the macro button.

command.description: The command to run when the macro button is clicked, or the macro is called.

props.description: A String Property List or JSON Object containing the properties for the button.

delim.description:
The delimiter used in the String Property List that is sent to the props parameter, defaults to `;`.
If you are sending a JSON Object to the props parameter, and using the id parameter, you should set this to `json`

label.description: The label for the macro button.

command.description: The command to run when the macro button is clicked, or the macro is called.

props.description: A String Property List or JSON Object containing the properties for the button.

delim.description:
The delimiter used in the String Property List that is sent to the props parameter, defaults to `;`.
If you are sending a JSON Object to the props parameter, and using the id parameter, you should set this to `json`

tokenRef.description: Either the token id or Token Name of the token that the macro is created on. From v1.15, accepts 'campaign' and 'gm' as ids for the relevant panels.

label.description: The label for the macro button.

command.description: The command to run when the macro button is clicked, or the macro is called.

props.description: A String Property List or JSON Object containing the properties for the button.

delim.description:
The delimiter used in the String Property List that is sent to the props parameter, defaults to `;`.
If you are sending a JSON Object to the props parameter, and using the id parameter, you should set this to `json`

tokenRef.description: Either the token id or Token Name of the token that the macro is created on. From v1.15, accepts 'campaign' and 'gm' as ids for the relevant panels.

mapname.description: The name of the map to find the token. Defaults to the current map.

returns: The index of the newly created button.
notes: See the wiki for more information.

name: createMap
description: Creates a map from the information in the required JSON object parameter.

name.description: She name of the new map.

notes: See the wiki for more info about the `congig` parameter.

name: createTable
description: Creates an empty table, specifying its access levels and optional image.

tableName.description: A string containing the name of the Table. **Warning: if a table with that name already exists it will be cleared.**

visible.description: Whether or not the table can be seen by players in the Table Window, true(1) or false(0).

accessible.description: Whether or not the table can be used by players to lookup values, true(1) or false(0).

imageId.description: Optional and is the asset id of an image that will be used for the table in the Table Window.

notes: **Warning: If a table with the same name already exists, it will be overridden by the new table.**

name: createToken
description: Creates a token from the information in the required JSON object parameter.

config.description: Configuration information for the new token; at a minimum must contain values under the `name` and `tokenImage` keys.

returns: The id of the created token.
notes: The JSON object

name: createTokens
description: Creates a token as per `createToken()` for each entry in the input array.

configs.description: Array of config objects for the new tokens.

notes: See `createToken()` for information about the elements of the `configs` array.

name: currentToken
description: Returns the id of the Current Token.
returns: The id of the Current Token.
notes: In most cases this will return the same as `getImpersonated()` function. The difference is when it is called in a `[token():]` or after a call to the `switchToken()` function, in both these cases it will return the id of the token being operated on, while `getImpersonated()` will return the id of the impersonated token.

name: data.getData
description: Returns a JSON dictionary containing the value held within the datastore under the named key.

type.description: Uri protocol for the data store. (Usually 'addon:')

namespace.description: The namespace for the data store.

key.description: The Key of the datum to retrieve.

returns: The value held within the datastore under the named key.

name: data.getStaticData

namespace.description: The namespace for the data store.

key.description: The Key of the datum to retrieve.

returns: The contents of the static data (usually a file).
notes: Currently, the only type of data this function can return is for Add-On Libraries

name: data.listData
description: Enumerates all data in a namespace.

type.description: Uri protocol for the data store. (Usually 'addon:')

namespace.description: The namespace for the data store.

returns: A JSON array of JSON dictionaries describing each element of data within the namespace.

name: data.listNamespaces
description: List data namespaces.
returns: A JSON Array of namespaces.

name: data.listTypes
description: Returns an array of valid strings for use in data functions in the `type` argument.
returns: Array or strings.

name: data.removeData
description: Unknown

name: data.setData
description: Unknown

name: decode
description: Decodes a string that was encoded with the `encode()` function.
returns: The decoded string.

name: defineAudioSource
description: Assign a nickname to an audio source and optionally preload it or set playback values.

nickname.description: The nickname of the file. For example, 'tense music'

uri.description: The URI/URL of the file. For example, `http://www.mywebsite/mysong.mp3` or `file:/C:/mysong.mp3`

nickname.description: The nickname of the file. For example, 'tense music'

uri.description: The URI/URL of the file. For example, `http://www.mywebsite/mysong.mp3` or `file:/C:/mysong.mp3`

preload.description: A string indicating if the audio should be pre-loaded or not. If set to `clip`, preloads it as a clip. If set to `stream`, preloads it as a stream. Any other string does not preload the audio source.

nickname.description: The nickname of the file. For example, 'tense music'

uri.description: The URI/URL of the file. For example, `http://www.mywebsite/mysong.mp3` or `file:/C:/mysong.mp3`

preload.description: A string indicating if the audio should be pre-loaded or not. If set to `clip`, preloads it as a clip. If set to `stream`, preloads it as a stream. Any other string does not preload the audio source.

cycleCount.description: Set the default number of times the audio should play. If set to -1, the file is played continuously.

nickname.description: The nickname of the file. For example, 'tense music'

uri.description: The URI/URL of the file. For example, `http://www.mywebsite/mysong.mp3` or `file:/C:/mysong.mp3`

preload.description: A string indicating if the audio should be pre-loaded or not. If set to `clip`, preloads it as a clip. If set to `stream`, preloads it as a stream. Any other string does not preload the audio source.

cycleCount.description: Set the default number of times the audio should play. If set to -1, the file is played continuously.

volume.description: Set the default volume the audio is to be played at. Can range from 0 to 1.

nickname.description: The nickname of the file. For example, 'tense music'

uri.description: The URI/URL of the file. For example, `http://www.mywebsite/mysong.mp3` or `file:/C:/mysong.mp3`

preload.description: A string indicating if the audio should be pre-loaded or not. If set to `clip`, preloads it as a clip. If set to `stream`, preloads it as a stream. Any other string does not preload the audio source.

cycleCount.description: Set the default number of times the audio should play. If set to -1, the file is played continuously.

volume.description: Set the default volume the audio is to be played at. Can range from 0 to 1.

start.description: Set the default time offset in seconds where audio should start playing, or restart from when repeating. Streams only.

nickname.description: The nickname of the file. For example, 'tense music'

uri.description: The URI/URL of the file. For example, `http://www.mywebsite/mysong.mp3` or `file:/C:/mysong.mp3`

preload.description: A string indicating if the audio should be pre-loaded or not. If set to `clip`, preloads it as a clip. If set to `stream`, preloads it as a stream. Any other string does not preload the audio source.

cycleCount.description: Set the default number of times the audio should play. If set to -1, the file is played continuously.

volume.description: Set the default volume the audio is to be played at. Can range from 0 to 1.

start.description: Set the default time offset in seconds where audio should start playing, or restart from when repeating. Streams only.

stop.description: Set the default time offset where audio should stop playing or restart when repeating. Streams only.

notes: The source can now be played with `playStream()`.

name: defineFunction
description: Defines a user function that can be used anywhere that core functions can be used.

function.description: The name of the user defined function to be defined.

macro.description: The name and location of the macro that is called when the user defined function is used.

function.description: The name of the user defined function to be defined.

macro.description: The name and location of the macro that is called when the user defined function is used.

ignoreOutput.description: If the defined function should ignore all output and only return the value of `macro.return`, defaults to false(`0`).

function.description: The name of the user defined function to be defined.

macro.description: The name and location of the macro that is called when the user defined function is used.

ignoreOutput.description: If the defined function should ignore all output and only return the value of `macro.return`, defaults to false(`0`).

newScope.description: Whether the defined function should create a new variable scope when executed. Defaults to true(`1`).

notes: See the wiki for more information.

name: deleteStrProp
description: Returns a copy of the string property list with the specified key (and corresponding valye) removed.
returns: A copy of the input property list with the specified key removed.

name: deleteTable
description: Removes the specified table from the campaign.

tableName.description: The name of the table to be deleted.

name: deleteTableEntry
description: Removes a row from the specified table.

roll.description: An integer and the value that specifies the row to be removed.

notes: Deleting a row from a table will not automatically change the table row value, so this should be updated to avoid possible errors.

name: deselectTokens

tokenRef.description: Either the token id or Token Name of the token to deselect; if left blank all currently selected tokens are deselected.

tokens.description: A String List of tokens to deselect.

delim.description: Specifies the delimiter used in the string list that is supplied. Use `json` for JSON Arrays.

notes: Token IDs are unique, but Token Names can be duplicated. Using Token Name when more than one token has the same name can produce unexpected results.

name: divide
description: Divides the first number by the second number, and then divides that result by the third number -if present- and so on for all the numbers passed to the function.
returns: The result of the division.

name: drawCoverVBL
description: Draws Cover Vision Blocking Layer (Cover VBL) shapes.

shapeArray.description: A JSON Array of JSON objects, one of the latter for each Cover VBL shape.

notes: See `drawVBL()` for a complete description of possible shapes.

name: drawHillVBL
description: Draws Hill Vision Blocking Layer (Hill VBL) shapes.

shapeArray.description: A JSON Array of JSON objects, one of the latter for each Hill VBL shape.

notes: See `drawVBL()` for a complete description of possible shapes.

name: drawMBL
description: Draws Movement Blocking Layer (MBL) shapes.

shapeArray.description: A JSON Array of JSON objects, one of the latter for each MBL shape.

notes: See `drawVBL()` for a complete description of possible shapes.

name: drawPitVBL
description: Draws Pit Vision Blocking Layer (Pit VBL) shapes.

shapeArray.description: A JSON Array of JSON objects, one of the latter for each Pit VBL shape.

notes: See `drawVBL()` for a complete description of possible shapes.

name: drawVBL
description: Draws Wall Vision Blocking Layer (Wall VBL) shapes.

shapeArray.description: A JSON Array of JSON objects, one of the latter for each Pit VBL shape.

notes: See the wiki for a complete description of possible shapes.

name: drop
description: Generates random numbers to emulate dice rolls; returns the total of a dice roll that ignores a certain number of the lowest dice rolled.

times.description: The number of times to roll the dice.

sides.description: The number of sides the dice possess.

ignore.description: The number of *lowest* rolls that are ignored when totaling the roll.

returns: The sum result of the dice roll.
notes: For another method of rolling dice, see **Dice Expressions**.

name: dropHighest
description: Generates random numbers to emulate dice rolls; returns the total of a dice roll that ignores a certain number of the highest dice rolled.

times.description: The number of times to roll the dice.

sides.description: The number of sides the dice possess.

ignore.description: The number of *highest* rolls that are ignored when totaling the roll.

returns: The sum result of the dice roll.
notes: For another method of rolling dice, see **Dice Expressions**.

name: editStream
description: Edit an audio stream currently playing.

uri.description: The uri/url of the stream to edit. If set to '*', all audio streams are edited.

cycleCount.description: The number of times the audio should play. If set to 0, the file is cached but not played; if set to -1, the file is played continuously. If set to a blank string '', the property is not changed. Defaults to ''.

volume.description: The volume the audio is to be played at. Can range from 0 to 1. If set to '', the property is not changed. Defaults to ''.

start.description: The time offset in seconds where audio should start playing, or restart from when repeating. If set to '', the property is not changed. Defaults to ''.

stop.description: The time offset where audio should stop playing or restart when repeating. If set to '', the property is not changed. Defaults to ''

name: encode
description: Encodes a string that was can be decoded with the `decode()` function.
returns: The encoded string.
notes: The `decode()` and `encode()` functions can be used to encode a property list so that it can be embedded within another property list.

name: endsWith
description: Returns 1 if the string ends with a certain sub string.

str.description: In string to check the end of.

substr.description: The sub-string to test the end of `str` for.

returns: True (1) if the end of the string `str` matches the string `substr`, otherwise false (0).

name: equals
description: This functions checks for equality between all of the passed in values.

args.description: The strings or numbers to compare.

returns: True (1) if the strings or numbers are equivalent. Mixed strings and numbers always return false (0).
notes: You can use it for string (case-insensitive) or numeric comparisons but not both at the same time.

name: equalsStrict
description: This function checks for equality between all of the passed in values. Unlike `equals()` this function can only be used for string values and is case-sensitive.
returns: True (1) if all strings are exactly equal (case-sensitive).

name: eraseCoverVBL
description: Erases Cover Vision Blocking Layer (Cover VBL) shapes from the Map VBL.

shapeArray.description: An array of one or more shapes as JSON objects.

notes: This function does not affect Token VBL. See the wiki for details on defining `shapeArray`.

name: eraseHillVBL
description: Erases Hill Vision Blocking Layer (Hill VBL) shapes from the Map VBL.

shapeArray.description: An array of one or more shapes as JSON objects.

notes: This function does not affect Token VBL. See the wiki for details on defining `shapeArray`.

name: eraseMBL
description: Erases Movement Blocking Layer (MBL) shapes from the Map MBL.

shapeArray.description: An array of one or more shapes as JSON objects.

notes: This function does not affect Token MBL. See the wiki for details on defining `shapeArray`.

name: erasePitVBL
description: Erases Pit Vision Blocking Layer (Pit VBL) shapes from the Map VBL.

shapeArray.description: An array of one or more shapes as JSON objects.

notes: This function does not affect Token VBL. See the wiki for details on defining `shapeArray`.

name: eraseVBL
description: Erases Wall Vision Blocking Layer (Wall VBL) shapes from the Map VBL.

shapeArray.description: An array of one or more shapes as JSON objects.

notes: This function does not affect Token VBL. See the wiki for details on defining `shapeArray`.

name: eval
description: Evaluates an expression in a string and returns the result.
returns: The result of the expression.
notes: The string contains the same type of expression that is usually located between macro brackets (e.g { } or [r: 2+2]).

name: evalMacro
description: Evaluates and 'executes' the macro in a string and returns the result. Uses the *current* scope.

macroString.description: The macro script that is evaluated.

returns: The output of the evaluated macro.
notes: The string contains the same type of macro commands that you would put in a token macro with the exception that it can not contain slash commands.

name: execMacro
description: Evaluates and 'executes' the macro in a string and returns the result. Uses a *new* scope.

macroString.description: The macro script that is executed.

returns: The output of the executed macro.
notes: The string contains the same type of macro commands that you would put in a token macro with the exception that it can not contain slash commands.

name: execFunction
description: Invokes a built-in macro function or user-defined function (UDF) on one or more clients.

defer.description: If true (1), invokes the function after the current macro has completed.

targets.description: The user names (so not token names) but the names of the users that are logged in. The options 'gm', 'gm-self', 'self', 'not-self', 'not-gm', 'not-gm-self', 'none', and 'all' are also valid

delim.description: The delimiter used to separate the values in the String List that is given, defaults to ','. If 'json' is specified, a JSON array is expected instead of a String List.

notes: No output from the executed function will be presented on the targets.

name: explode
description: Generates random numbers to emulate dice rolls; returns the total of a dice roll where dice that are rolled at maximum value are rolled again with the new roll added to the old.

times.description: The number of dice to roll.

sides.description: The number of sides the dice possess.

limit.description: The maximum number of rerolls available for each die. Set to -1 for no limit.

returns: The result (sum) of the dice roll

name: explodingSuccess
description: Generates random numbers to emulate dice rolls; any dice that are rolled at maximum value are rolled again with the new roll added to the old.

times.description: The number of dice to roll.

sides.description: The number of sides the dice possess.

target.description: The number that a dice needs to be equal to or higher to be considered a success (added to the count returned).

returns: A string showing the result of each die and the total number of successes.

name: exportData
description: Allows the storage of string data into an external file.

pathname.description: The path that data will be written to; this file will be created if it doesn't already exist.

data.description: The string written to the file.

append.description: If true (1), the data is appended to the end of the file if it exists, otherwise overwrites an existing contents.

notes: The Allow External Macro Access option in MapTool's Preferences must be enabled or this macro aborts with an error.

name: exposeAllOwnedArea
description: Exposes all area visible to tokens owned by the current player that have vision turned on in the token editor.

mapName.description: The name of an existing map within the campaign.

notes: The actual area exposed depends on server settings (like Individual Views) and various MapTool Preferences.

name: exposeFogAtWaypoints
description: Returns a string (Enabled/Disabled) indicating whether the Expose Fog At Waypoints option is set in the MapTool Map menu.
returns: A string ('Enabled' or 'Disabled') indicating whether the Expose Fog At Waypoints option is set in the MapTool Map menu.

name: exposeFOW
description: Clears the Fog of War (FOW) for all selected tokens on the current map according to their sight settings.

mapname.description: The name of the map to expose on.

tokens.description: Tokens to use instead of which are currently selected.

_param.description: The delimiter for the `tokens` list. Use 'json' for a JSON Array

name: exposePCOnlyArea
description: Clears Fog of War (FOW) where PC tokens can see and establishes/restores FOW everywhere they cannot.

mapname.description: The name of the map to reveal on.

notes: This function is often used in combination with the onTokenMove event.

name: findDrawings
description: Returns the id or ids of any drawing on the specified map that matches the name parameter.

mapName.description: The name of the map to search.

name.description: name of the searched for drawings. Pass '*' to get all drawings. Drawings can be named via the Draw Explorer interface or using setDrawingName().

delim.description: Separator for the output. If 'json' is used, the output will be a JSON Array.

returns: The id or ids of any drawing on the specified map that matches the name parameter.

name: findToken
description: Finds a token on the current map by the token name, GM name, or ID and returns its id.

tokenRef.description: Either the `id` or Token Name of the token.

mapname.description: Optional name of the map to search for the token on.

returns: The id of the found token or an empty string if no token is found.
notes: It is undefined what is returned if multiple tokens match the given `tokenRef`.

name: flipTokenIso
description: Flip the current token image in the Isomeric plane like the right-click menu option.

tokenRef.description: Either the token `id` or Token Name of the token

map.description: Map the token is located on.

returns: New flipped status (0 or 1)

name: flipTokenX
description: Flip the current token image horizontally like the right-click menu option.

tokenRef.description: Either the token `id` or Token Name of the token

map.description: Map the token is located on.

name: flipTokenY
description: Flip the current token image vertically like the right-click menu option.

tokenRef.description: Either the token `id` or Token Name of the token

map.description: Map the token is located on.

returns: New flipped status (0 or 1)

name: floor
description: Mathmatical floor operation.
returns: The closest integer not greater than `num`.

name: formatStrProp
description: Returns a custom-formatted version of the property string.

props.description: The input list of key=value pairs.

listFormat.description: Emitted once. It should contain the text '%list', which is replaced with the formatted items.

entryFormat.description: Emitted once *per item*. Any instances of '%key' and '%value' in the string are replaced with the key or value for that setting.

separator.description: Emitted in between the formatted items.

returns: The fully formatted string.

name: fudge
description: Generates random numbers to emulate FUDGE dice rolls; returns the total of a special Fudge dice roll.

times.description: The number of dice to roll.

returns: The sum of the FUDGE rolls.
notes: When these dice are rolled, the result is -1, 0, or 1, this function then sums up all of the dice rolled and returns that sum.
